Fields.DialogueText: Howdy, Cap!
Howdy, Texas!
Ha! Yer finally learnin' how to talk like a Texan!
What can I say? We've been spending a lot of time together lately. I suppose you're having an effect on me.
We have been at sea for a while now, haven't we? That last battle was tougher than stewed skunk, though!

Fields.MenuText: Well, when the bullets started flying, you really showed those Morganas some of your best trick shooting!
We got through it all together, like the Lone Ranger and Tonto!
With me leading the fleet, those Morganas didn't stand a chance!

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! I am gettin' pretty good at those behind-the-back shots, ain't I? Did ya know I ain't even left-handed neither?
It's almost like we can read each other's minds in the middle of a fight, ain't it? I've always got yer back, Cap!
Hell, you can strut sittin' down, can't you, Cap? The crew really saved our bacon against those Morganas, so don't forget who's doin' all the heavy liftin' 'round here!
That last battle got me thinkin' though - I've ridden a lot of trails and roped up my fair share of banditos in my day.
You're one of the most accomplished Belles in the fleet. It's an honor to sail with you!
I do love sailin', Cap, but I'm a cowgirl at heart. Sailin's kept me away from home for too long. I think this war might be my last rodeo on the high seas.
You're really going to hang up your sailing hat after the war?
Well, I'm fixin' to settle down eventually. Maybe I'll drop anchor 'round Houston... find a nice partner to keep me company on the ranch.
A nice partner, huh? Any potential candidates?
I'm an independent lady, so I need someone who can keep up with me. I don't need a fancy city slicker with a lot of moolah, but I do need someone who can ride, rope, and shoot.
Ha! Sounds like you want a real a cowboy.
Yep... and no offense, Cap, but it looks like you ain't got no spurs.
Oh... I see...
*BOOM*
Looks like the Morganas are back... let's talk more later.
@BATTLE
*SNORT* *NARROWED EYE*
Where we headed now, Cap?
That fight in the harbor against Sabotage and all those Morganas used up more ammunition and fuel than planned.
We also took some damage across the fleet, so we need to head into port for a refit.
About our conversation on the deck the other day, Cap - I'm really sorry if I hurt yer feelin's! It's just that I--

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry about it, Texas. We're all professionals on this ship, and we know that fraternization is against the rules.
You're giving up on me too early, Texas! Once I learn how to ride and shoot, I'll rope your heart in a New York minute!
It's okay. If you're going to settle down in Texas, you need someone who understands you. Only a real cowboy could do that.

Fields.DialogueText: Let's not make things awkward, Cap. We've got the crew and the war to think about, and a mission to focus on.
I couldn't agree more. We shouldn't be having these kinds of conversations on the bridge anyway.
Let's chart a course back to port.
*ALARM*
We'll have to shoot our way through a few Morganas before we go anywhere, Cap!
We're always great partners, Texas... at least when it comes to fighting Morganas together!
@BATTLE
Aye, Cap. No funny business goin' on 'round here!
We need to focus on fightin' for now, Cap. I can figure out all that settlin' down stuff later.
You're tellin' me. I gotta work a few dings outta Bluebonnet.
*BRISTLE* *SKEPTICAL NICKER*
I said what I said. You'll take your maintenance an' like it, you big baby.
The harbor looks beautiful, doesn't it?
It ain't too bad, but city life is noisier than cats makin' kittens. I'd rather be out on the range where there's peace and quiet.
Don't you like the energy of the city, though? So many people and ideas from all over the world, and so much to do!
There's plenty enough to do on the ranch, Cap. I wish I was back there, to be honest...

Fields.MenuText: You're really missing Texas life, aren't you? Don't worry - the war will be over soon enough!
Is there anything I can do to make life on the ship more comfortable? Seems like you're homesick lately.
You'd rather sit on your front porch staring at cows instead of living it up in the big city?

Fields.DialogueText: The only reason I'm fightin' banditos is so I can get back home, Cap. I'm pretty sure most of the crew feels the same way.
I'm doin' fair to middlin', Cap, but thanks for askin'. I've just been at sea for so long now that I'm startin' to forget what it's like bein' 'round horses and the herd.
I can paint the town and the front porch when I want to, Cap! Just been thinkin' about home a little more lately - that's all.
Well, a few days in port will be good for everyone. We could all use a little rest.
Aye, Cap! Sorry for bein' a bit moody lately... After this refit, I'll be rarin' to get back out there to chase down those brujas!
Good to hear! The crew always appreciates your enthusiasm when the bullets start flying.
*GUNFIRE* *WHINNY*
Bluebonnet says we got Morganas, Cap! We ain't back at the ranch just yet! Vámonos!
@BATTLE
*SEAGULLS*
It's always an adjustment being back on dry land again.
The high seas are a lot like the open range, but I don't mind havin' my legs on solid ground.
Any plans while we're in port?
I'll try to hunt down some more silver to melt down. Those silver bullets I made last time really did a number on those brujas!
How about you, Cap? What're you up to while we're in port?

Fields.MenuText: I've got to catch up on some administrative things, so I'll mostly be in my quarters signing off on paperwork.
I need to supervise the refit, but I suppose it wouldn't hurt to slip away for a few hours for a little sightseeing.
This last sortie was far too stressful! If anyone needs me, you'll find me in the closest bar. If I'm asleep, please go ahead and wake me.

Fields.DialogueText: That sounds as excitin' as watchin' paint dry, Cap! I ain't a city girl, but you should get out there and have some fun.
Sounds like a plan, Cap! I wonder if they've got any good barbeque around here...
There are healthier ways to blow off some steam in port, Cap! Which reminds me - I wonder if there are any casinos 'round here...
In any case, I am looking forward to relaxing a bit. I worry about the ship 24 hours a day when we're at sea. At least when we're in port, I only have to worry during office hours.
*ALARM*
Sounds like there's a Morgana fleet comin' straight down the coast. Got one more shootout in ya before shore leave?
The Lone Ranger and Tonto are always ready to fight for justice, Texas!
Ha! Let's mount up and ride these Morganas right out of town, Cap!
@BATTLE
*SEAGULLS*
Ready to head back out to sea, Cap?
Yes, we're all done with the refit. The crew is rested, and we've resupplied with all the fuel, food, and ammunition we need for another sortie.
We're cookin' on the front burner today, ain't we?
We're ready to take on anything the Morganas throw at us out there!
What's that you're carrying? It looks awfully heavy...
Oh, well, I was just teachin' some of the locals a little Texas culture.
Ah, it's always nice to share your culture when you're traveling! But that doesn't explain what's in your bag...
Silver dollars, or whatever the heck this foreign currency is. I was teachin' some of the locals how to play hold 'em down at that bar yonder.
They never figured out how to call my bluff! Nice people, but not worth spit when it comes to playin' poker.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't know you were a gambler. You're full of surprises, Texas!
I can't believe you won all that money! How much do you have there?
Frankly, I'm surprised you don't have an angry mob of locals chasing you down the dock!

Fields.DialogueText: Gamblin' implies there's a chance ya might lose, Cap. In which case, I ain't gamblin' when I'm sat down at a poker table.
No idea what all these foreign coins are worth, but they are darn heavy!
That's what my gun's for, Cap - it keeps everyone civilized at the poker table.
I'm pretty sure these coins are pure silver, though, so I can melt 'em down to make more bullets to take down those brujas.
I'm sure they'll come in handy, but we should weigh anchor as soon as possible. There are Morganas in the harbor again, but frankly I'm more worried about getting attacked by angry locals.
Don't worry, Cap! I admit the locals were a little upset at first, but they were all smiles by the time I left - at least after I pulled out my six-shooter.
Let's save all the gunslinging for the Morganas, Texas!
Fantastico idea, Cap! Just point my guns in the right direction!
@BATTLE
So... what do you think?
Thank ya kindly, Cap, but I... I just don't know what to say!
I figured since you were missing life on the ranch, I could bring a bit of the ranch to us on the ship!
When you said you had a surprise for me, I wasn't expectin' to see a herd of longhorns and a pair of broncos on the deck.
How'd you even manage to track down all these critters at our last port call?

Fields.MenuText: It was a complex chain of back alley trades, combined with calling in an overdue favor from the harbormaster - but it was all worth it for you!
It wasn't cheap, if I have to be honest - but that just shows how much I care about you!
I can rustle up a herd of longhorns anywhere!

Fields.DialogueText: Heck... you didn't have to go through all that trouble just because I was feelin' homesick.
Oh... well, you didn't have to do that, Cap.
Ha! You ain't the cattle rustling type, Cap! I'm pretty sure you got 'em legally... or semi-legally at least.
I'm thrilled to pieces to be around a herd again, but how on earth are we gonna take care of 'em on the deck of a battleship?
I know it's my job to plan ahead for things on this ship... but I honestly didn't plan that far ahead with this. I just thought they'd make you feel more at home.
They do, but takin' care of a herd is a lot of hard work, Cap. It's not like havin' a house cat or a goldfish.
I know, but I just wanted to make you hap--
*BOOM*
Morganas!
The gunfire's spookin' the cattle, Cap! We gotta calm 'em down 'fore one of those dogies ends up jumpin' ship!
This isn't turning out how I planned!
Return fire! Sink every Morgana ship out there! And someone help Texas rope up this cattle!
@BATTLE
The crew converted one of the cargo holds into a corral, so we've got a place for the herd and horses below deck. I hope bein' down there will keep 'em calm when we're fightin'.
That's great news! When we were in port, I was thinking so hard about how to cheer you up. I should have considered how much work it would be to care for cows and horses on board.
Don't worry about it, Cap! It turns out that two of our crew are authentic Texas cowboys, and are makin' darn good cowhands! Fernando and Tommy are out there on deck ridin' herd all day.

Fields.MenuText: Fernando and Tommy, huh? You're on a first-name basis with the crew now?
You're kidding me - you found two sailors on the ship who are also experienced cowboys?
Well, I'm glad Fernando and Tommy can make up for my shortcomings...

Fields.DialogueText: Only with Fernando and Tommy - they saw me strugglin' with the herd all by my lonesome, and they jumped right in to help. I hit it off with 'em both right away!
It ain't that rare, Cap. There're plenty of Texans in the navy. 'Course not all of them look as good on horses as Fernando and Tommy...
Boy howdy, Cap! You should see how those two work cattle! They've got plenty of notches in their guns for sure!
I see. You do seem happier around the horses and herd, so I'm glad I brought them on board.
It's nice chattin' with Fernando and Tommy while I'm out there with the herd too. Just shootin' the breeze about Texas stuff, ya know?
Well... I'm glad you found some real cowboys to keep you company.
*BOOM*
Now don't be ugly, Cap! They're bein' kind enough to help out!
We've got Morganas ahead, Texas. We can talk about your two new cowboy friends later.
Aye, Cap! Fernando and Tommy are gunner's mates too, so I'll give 'em a holler and get this fight started!
Seems like Fernando and Tommy are two really talented fellows...
Don't look at me like that. That's an order.
@BATTLE
*KNOWING SNORT*
You shoulda seen how Fernando and Tommy sprung into action that day you surprised me on deck with the herd!
Oh, I remember it quite clearly. Don't worry...
When the Morganas fired on us, the herd got spooked and those longhorns were runnin' all over the deck! I thought we might lose a few cows if they went overboard...
But Fernando and Tommy jumped on those broncos right quick and circled the herd - even roped up a few stray cats 'fore they got into any trouble.

Fields.MenuText: First cattle, now cats? Where did we even get those?
If they're gunner's mates, then they can't go off playing cowboy when we need every gun pointed at those Morganas!
I was just about to jump on a horse and round up those longhorns myself. Those two just beat me to it.

Fields.DialogueText: Probably smelled the rats. Ports are like that. Nothin' like a food chain for a little pest control!
Now hold yer horses, Cap! They round up that herd faster 'n greased lightnin' and were back at their guns 'fore we fired our first salvo!
Yer blowin' more wind than a corn eatin' horse! You're a heck of a captain, but you ain't no cowboy!
In any case, I'm glad the herd escaped any trouble.
Howdy, Texas!
Howdy! Enjoyin' yer meal there with the Cap?
Howdy, boys! Yep, I was just tellin' the Cap here how impressed I was with your ridin' and ropin' the other day! It coulda been a real disaster with the whole herd spooked like that.
All in a day's work, Texas!
Si, señorita! We just did what caballeros do when there is danger! Even your gun horse can't do it all alone.
Well thanks again, gentlemen! Great to have two real cowboys on board, ain't it, Cap?
*ALARM*
Battle stations, everyone!
Hasta luego, muchachos! If these Morganas wanna dance, we'll show 'em the Texas two-step!
@BATTLE
*AFFRONTED WHICKER*
It's a real thing of beauty watchin' those two work the herd, ain't it? Look at how Fernando just roped up that steer that broke away!
I have to admit, the more I watch Fernando and Tommy ride their horses around those cows and effortlessly throw those lassos, the more impressed I get.
They're makin' hard stuff look easy, Cap. The only way you get any good at cowboyin' is practice, 'cause everyone's gotta start as a greenhorn sometime.

Fields.MenuText: So you're saying I could learn how to be a cowboy like Fernando and Tommy?
It can't be too different from throwing a docking line... except you're sitting on a horse... and the dock is a cow that's running away from you.
Just the thought of riding a horse on a rolling ship is making me seasick.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course you could, Cap! You're one of the brightest captains I've met. I'm sure you could pick up anything you put your mind to!
Ha! Sailin's nothin' like bein' a cowboy, Cap, so you've gotta learn things straight from the horse's mouth.
Can't say I've done much ridin' on a ship, Cap - but Fernando and Tommy seem to be doin' just fine!
Maybe I could learn a thing or two from Fernanado and Tommy...
They could put some snap in your garters, that's fer sure!
*BOOM*
Time to round up some more Morganas, Cap!
@BATTLE
Thanks for meeting with me down here, gentlemen.
No problem, capitán.
Aye, Captain! We're happy to follow orders... but we're not engineers, so why'd you wanna meet us down here in the engine room?
Well, I just wanted to have a word with you in private about Texas. You two have gotten really close to her over the past few weeks...
Captain, we're aware of the fraternization policy - and trust me, neither of us are interested in her anyway!
Si, Capitán! I love my esposa and niños back home - and Tommy found a nice foreign girl at our last port call!
We spent a few days together during shore leave and she doesn't speak much English, but she ain't like a Texas girl at all! I really love her, so we've made plans to get married after the war!

Fields.MenuText: Thank you for being so honest with me, gentlemen. I just want to make sure we maintain good order and discipline on the ship.
You don't have me convinced - you both seem pretty friendly around Texas!
Wait, you decided to marry a girl you just met after only a few days with her at the last port call?

Fields.DialogueText: Aye, Cap! We're cowboys back home, but on this ship we're sailors - and sailors follow orders.
Well, she is una hermosa tejana, Capitán - and we are vaqueros tejanos, so it's only natural to be friendly. But that's all!
I've already got a few exes in Texas, Cap. I ain't tryin' to add to that. This girl's really different though - in a good way.
That's a relief. In that case, I'd like to ask you gentlemen for a favor.
Go ahead and shoot, Cap!
I want you to teach me how to be a cowboy.
Aw, Cap! You done gone and took a shine to her, didn't ya?
... I need to show her that I can keep up with life on the ranch. It's awkward to ask you this, but I really need your help.
Capitán, we're happy to show you the ropes! All good stories end with the cowboy getting the señorita, no?
Ha! This'll be more fun than wrestlin' a greased pig, Cap! I'm all for it!
*ALARM*
I can't thank you enough! Let's talk more later - right now we need to get to our battle stations!
@BATTLE
It's funny to see you up there on a horse, Cap!
Yes, well. I figured it would be a good way to get off the bridge and get some fresh air. Fernando here was kind enough to show me the basics.
Sí, Texas! The Capitán is a real natural on a horse... for sure!
I dunno, Fernando... you reckon Cap's leanin' left a bit more than regular? Ain't nothin' short of a twister to wobble you worse.

Fields.MenuText: I assure you that I'm riding straight, Texas! Perhaps it's the rolling of the ship that's got you a bit confused.
I fell off the right side last time, so now I'm leaning to the left to compensate. Pretty clever of me, huh?
I just mounted up, Texas. Please give me a moment to adjust.

Fields.DialogueText: I know a good rider when I see one, Cap. Don't worry - you'll get there some day!
Yer bein' as sharp as a mashed potato, Cap! Now shift yer weight over to the right a bit!
Just take it slow, Cap. It's all new to ya, so don't hurt yerself now!
We're just working on the basics for now, Texas. Cap's picking things up quick, though.
*GUNFIRE*
Pony ridin's over for the day, Cap! Time to circle the wagons  - we've got Morganas incoming!
Can you please help me get off this horse, Texas? Fernando hasn't taught me that part yet.
Ha! Well, you don't need my help fallin' off!
They're waiting for me on the bridge, Texas. This isn't the right time for jokes...
Aye-aye, Cap! We'll get ya to the bridge right quick!
@BATTLE
What in the Sam Hill are you doin', Cap?
I'm starting to get the hang of riding, Texas. Fernando here is now teaching me how to herd.
Ha! I can see that, Cap. You've got those dogies rollin' all right!
Sí, Texas! To be honest, the Capitán fell off the horse a few times already, but I think we've seen the last of that!
I can see that, Fernando. Ain't lookin' half bad now!

Fields.MenuText: Fernando has me riding at the back of the herd - just to get started.
I only fell off three times... but at least I understand what I did wrong.
I don't know what Fernando is talking about with me falling off the horse. He's full of tall tales if you ask me!

Fields.DialogueText: Greenhorns aways start ridin' drag, Cap. It'll teach ya the basics, and you can work yer way up from there!
Nothin' wrong with fallin', Cap - so long as ya dust yerself off and get back on yer horse. Glad you're learnin' a thing or two!
Ha! Yer uniform looks a little dusty to me, Cap. So I reckon Fernando ain't stretchin' the truth too much!
Learning how to ride and herd is giving me a profound sense of freedom - even if we do have to turn the herd around every two minutes when we run out of deck.
The deck ain't exactly the open range, but it is nice bein' out here with the wind in yer hair.
It's a welcome relief from all the chatter on the bridge, that's for sure!
*BOOM*
Guess you can't stay away from the bridge for too long, huh, Cap?
A ship will always need its captain, Texas! Let's get to our battle stations and take care of these Morganas!
@BATTLE
"Voy a cantar esto versos pongan mucha atención todos..."
Howdy, Texas!
"Voy a cantar la tragedia de la Heroica Matamoros..."
Howdy, Texas!
Oh, howdy, Cap! I was so caught up in strummin' my guitar and singin' that ya snuck right up on me!
You've got a beautiful voice! What song is that? I didn't know you could sing in Spanish!
Aw, it's just an old tune about the the Battle of Matamoros in the Mexican Revolution. It's about how the rebels were outnumbered but still beat the Federales.
I'm tryin' to find some inspiration to write a song about our last big battle together against Sabotage, when she had us blockaded in that harbor.

Fields.MenuText: It was tense for a while there, but you really came through with your silver bullets and trick shots!
You should sing about how a brave captain and beautiful Belle come together in perfect harmony to fight off a band of evil banditos!
Just try to mention me by name if you can - it'll really help my next performance evaluation and chance for promotion!

Fields.DialogueText: I could only pull off those trick shots 'cause I was confident ya had my back, Cap!
We do work real well together, don't we, Cap? These long trail rides are easier when you've got a good partner who never lets ya down.
So that is the only thing officers think about, huh? I was just tryin' to write somethin' with emotion to commemorate the brave fightin' that happened.
I just hope you have a lot more good songs to write about us in the future, Texas.
I hope so too, Cap! But I don't want this war to last forever neither.
They don't all have to be songs about battle... I mean, you could also write songs about lo--
*GUNFIRE*
Do what now, Cap?
These Morganas have the absolute worst timing!
We'll keep on sinkin' 'em until they start singin' a different tune, Cap!
@BATTLE
All right, now ya just wanna focus on the front sight, and bring yer arm up to put it right under that Sun Tang bottle down yonder. Just nice and easy...
This is a lot slower than all those cowboy serials with their quick draws and shooting from the hip...
That's all Hollywood, Cap. Yer not gonna hit the broad side of a barn if you start shootin' like that. Ya need to learn the basics first. Now just gently squeeze that trigger...
Right, just squeeze...
*BOOM*
Incoming fire from Morganas, Cap! Although you still did hit that Sun Tang bottle!
Ha! I've got five bullets left, so I might as well use them on our univited guests!
@BATTLE
Yer shootin' was hotter than a burnin' stump in that last battle, Cap! How'd you get so good all of a sudden?

Fields.MenuText: Tommy was kind enough to show me the basics. The Morgana attack was a great opportunity for a practical exercise!
I'm just watching you, Texas! I'm learning from the best!
I picked up some meditation techniques from my travels in the East. I am at one with my gun... when I pull the trigger, my energy flies with the bullet...

Fields.DialogueText: Those Morganas do have terrible timing, don't they? Tommy's a great shot, so I'm sure he's a good teacher.
Aw, you ain't seen nothin' yet, Cap! I'm working on a new ricochet shot - figure if I can bounce a silver bullet off a Morgana's deck and mast, I can hit those brujas from behind!
Now yer not makin' one ounce of sense, Cap! But I can't argue with the results!
Anyhoo, yer really impressin' me lately, Cap! You're ridin' and shootin' like a real cowboy these days. Didn't think you had it in ya!
Thanks, Texas! Whether I'm a cowpuncher or a captain, we'll always be ready to take down those Morganas together!
*POINTED SNORT*
Takin' into account that the horse an' I are a package deal.
Damn straight.
We've got a new mission today, Texas.
I'm always ready to ride, Cap.
It's a merchant ship convoy mission. We'll be heading back across that stretch of water where we fought Sabotage last time.
That's a dangerous trail, Cap. We already sank Sabotage, though, so we just need to make sure we don't get trapped in that harbor again.
I've instructed the navigator to chart a course well away from the shoreline, so that shouldn't happen again.
Sounds peachy. I'm sure all those cowboyin' skills you've been pickin' up will come in handy to protect all the merchant ships in our convoy.

Fields.MenuText: Herding cattle isn't too different from escorting a convoy. We can sail on point to blow any Morganas right out of the water.
I've been working on my long gun shooting with Tommy. We can pick off any approaching Morganas before they get close.
We can use the smaller ships in our fleet to ride flank and make sure none of the merchant ships accidentally break away from the convoy.

Fields.DialogueText: Ya may not be ready to ride point on a cattle drive just yet, but you can sure as hell sail up front in a convoy, Cap. Nobody's gonna mess with the size of our guns!
Good thinkin', Cap! Keep 'em at a distance with a little jab, then circle 'round for the one-two knockout!
You're learnin' a lot about herdin', aren't ya? Good idea to keep the merchant ships close - some of these civvie captains aren't used to military convoys, so we've got to keep 'em in line.
Now might be a good time to melt down all that silver you won gambling. We might need a lot of silver bullets considering all the Morgana activity in the area.
Good thinkin', Cap, but I'm way ahead of ya! I melted it all down a few days ago, and handed 20 bullets each to Fernando and Tommy.
Fernando and Tommy again, huh? Am I going to get any silver bullets from you?
As for y'all... Tommy's the best shot on board, and Fernando's not too far off neither. But you, Cap - ya still got... accuracy issues sometimes.
Accuracy issues? I only missed one Morgana in that last battle! I swear it was the first time that's ever happened!
*ALARM*
Just stick to sailin' for now, Cap - you're better at that. Looks like some brujas are flyin' in on our convoy, so let's shoot 'em off their broomsticks!
@BATTLE
*HOPEFUL NUDGE*
I ain't forgotten you, Bluebonnet. You'll get some silver cubes when we hang this bruja up to dry.
She still doesn't seem very impressed with me, and I don't know what else to do!
You've already improved a lot, Capitán! You can't give up now!
Fernando is right - you're ridin' and shootin' better than ever. You'll be a real cowboy soon enough!
I hope so. I'm starting to get saddle sores from all this horse riding, and they're terribly uncomfortable...
Don't worry, Cap. Today we're gonna add another weapon to your cowboy arsenal - barbecue. If this doesn't impress Texas, then I don't know what will.

Fields.MenuText: Brilliant plan! They say the best way to a Belle's heart is through her stomach!
Texas made me amazing barbecue before, so if I return the favor, she'll clearly think highly of me!
This is a fantastic activity to work on while my saddle sores heal up!

Fields.DialogueText: I heard that Belles mostly like to drink oil - but Texas does seem to enjoy her barbecue!
A true cowboy can hold his own in a gunfight, in a rodeo, and in the barbecue pit, Cap!
Didn't know you were so delicate down there, Cap! Don't worry - barbecue is more about patience and knowin' the right way to do things.
Okay, so what are we making?
Brisket, Cap. You take a tough piece of meat, and cook it low and slow until it's tender but still juicy. Usually it's over mesquite smoke, but we'll use the boilers here on the ship.
Now the first step is seasoning. Fifty percent salt, and fifty percent pepper. That's it - authentic Texas brisket.
What are you talking about, Tommy? That's not brisket! You need some paprika, chili - what kind of shoe leather recipe are you teaching the capitán, huh?
Calm down, Fernando! Do ya wanna be able to taste the beef, or do ya just wanna taste fire instead?
Ay, dios mío! Your cooking is always so bland, Tommy!
Gentlemen! I appreciate the help, but there's no need to argue about these trivial matters!
Hold yer horses, Cap... did you really just say that barbecue is... trivial?
*ALARM*
Okay, I think this is actually a great time for an interruption for once! Battle stations, everyone! Let's get these Morganas away from our convoy - and our barbecue!
@BATTLE
*THUD*
So - what do you think, Texas?
How in tarnation did ya learn how to make brisket?
Fernando and Tommy helped me out. They couldn't quite agree on the recipe, so it's a bit of a compromise.
Well, it sure smells delicious!

Fields.MenuText: Barbecue sure does require a lot of patience, but I think it turned out great in the end.
There's variation in the wood for smoking and the spices for the rub. Such diversity in something so deceptively simple.
I cooked it low... and slow... all... night... long.

Fields.DialogueText: Ya gotta admire a captain who's got the patience to see the job through to the end, makin' sure it's done right.
Hell, Cap - we make a big fuss about the right way to do things, but at the end of the day, it's pretty tough to mess up a barbecue.
Hope that makes up for yer accuracy problems on the quick draw!
I gotta admit, though, this brisket is some of the best I've had in a long time. Really reminds me of home!
I'm glad you like it, Texas. It was a team effort, though - Fernando and Tommy helped me out a lot.
Aw, Cap - don't sell yerself short! I'm as happy as a clam right now thanks to your brisket!
*BOOM*
Those Morganas are nippin' at our heels again! We'll have to get back to this picnic later, Cap!
@BATTLE
Yer doin' good, Cap! Just follow through a little bit more when ya let go of the rope.
That's what Fernando's been telling me, but I'm still a little stiff in the elbow.
You need to aim ahead of the vaca to get it over its head too, Capitán.

Fields.MenuText: Throwing a lasso onto a moving cow is hard enough - but you want me to learn how to do it while on the back of a horse too?
Thanks for all the tips from the peanut gallery, folks!
I swear I can do it when you're not watching! It's too much pressure when you're both staring at me like that.

Fields.DialogueText: If you want to be the first cowpuncher who walks 100 miles behind the herd on a cattle drive, then practicing on the horse isn't so important, Capitán.
You won't get better if no one points out what's wrong, Capitán.  Even then, you won't get better unless you listen.
The cows are always looking at you, Capitán. I don't think two more sets of eyes should make much of a difference.
I honestely do appreciate the help. It's frustrating when I can't pick things up right away, but I'll keep trying.
Keep at it, Cap! I think you've got a lot of potential!
I see some Morganas on the horizon, Capitán!
They're a little too far away to rope in, but I'm pretty sure our guns can reach them!
We just gotta lead 'em a bit, Cap! It ain't much different from ropin' cattle. I'll get the guns ready! Locked and loaded, Bluebonnet?
@BATTLE
*WHINNY* *EQUESTRIAN FIRE CONTROL ENGAGED*
You heard him! Let's ride!
I got a weird feelin', Cap.
What is it, Texas?
I can't explain why, but I just have this feelin' - Sabotage is comin' back at us!
Sabotage? But we already sank her!
Bluebonnet's right. That's the thing with these brujas, Cap. They don't always like stayin' sunk.

Fields.MenuText: If we sunk her once, we can sink her again.
We'll have to use more silver bullets this time to make sure she stays sunk - and by "we" I mean you, Fernando, and Tommy.
I wonder how we'll ever win against the Morganas if they keep coming back like this...

Fields.DialogueText: We'll punch more holes than Swiss cheese in her, Cap! Let's she if she can stay afloat after that!
We're always a team on this ship, Cap! Can't do nothin' without a captain, but can't do nothin' without a crew neither!
I wonder the same thing, Cap - but the best we can do fer now is keep fightin' em to keep the shippin' lanes clear for the civvie ships.
Good point, Texas. I'll keep that in mind.
Sabotage feels different this time too - seems like she's managed to get even stronger than before.
We'll have to keep an eye out for her. I don't understand how a sunk ship can come back even stronger, but then again not much about these Morganas makes any sense.
Aye, Cap - but for now it looks like we've got a few other Morganas ahead of us.
Nothing's going to stop this cattle drive as long as I'm riding point, Texas - and that includes Sabotage!
@BATTLE
*HEAD SHAKES* *FOREBODING SNORT*
It's quiet out here on the deck today, ain't it?
Yes, no cowboy training for me today. Fernando and Tommy have the day off.
You've been trainin' real hard lately, Cap! Seems like you're getting real good at ridin', herdin', and ropin'. Yer shootin's still a little funny, but yer makin' progress across the board.
Yes, but...
What's wrong, Cap?

Fields.MenuText: I've been trying so hard to impress you, but it never seems to be good enough to win your heart. I'll never be a real cowboy...
If I got a little better at shooting, would that finally be enough to convince you that I'm enough of a cowboy to help you run your ranch?
I'll never be half as good at cowboying as Fernando and Tommy, will I?

Fields.DialogueText: You're gettin' better every day, Cap! I really admire the fact that you ain't givin' up.
Shootin's not yer strong point, but even that can get better with practice.
Those two have been cowboyin' their whole lives! You can't expect to be as good as them overnight.
Besides, Cap - I think ya got me read all wrong. I ain't some fairytale princess that ya win as a prize with some carnival game trick shootin'.
And when I talk about wantin' someone to settle down with, they don't have to be a cowboy's cowboy, but they need to have a cowboy's heart, Cap.
A cowboy isn't just about ridin' and shootin'. When it comes to what really makes a cowboy, it's about takin' care of yerself, takin' care of yer herd and takin' care of yer crew.
A cowboy never backs down from a challenge, and always gets back on his horse whenever he gets thrown off. So when I say I need a cowboy, that's what I mean.
I see. Well... I have been thrown off my horse a fair number of times since I started all this cowboy business.
And ya got back on every time, didn't ya?
Well, aside from that one day where I had really bad saddle sores - yes. But if you just mean that in a figurative sense, then it's true - I always got back on the horse.
I know it takes me a while to warm up to people sometimes, but I guess what I'm sayin' is... don't give up on me just yet, Cap.
*ALARM*
It's Sabotage this time, Cap. I can feel her. She's real close!
Well let's saddle up, Texas. We're not giving up sinking her either!
@BATTLE
Sabotage is definitely stronger than she was last time, Cap!
She's taking on water, but it looks like she's coming back for more!
@BATTLE
We've pushed Sabotage back again, but we can't seem to keep her sunk!
We need to use the silver bullets, Cap. They're the only things that work against these brujas!

Fields.MenuText: Good thinking! We need to use every resource we have available in this fight!
Right - we just need a good plan to get close enough to use them.
You really think those silver bullets will make a difference? It seems like the Morganas keep on coming at us no matter what!

Fields.DialogueText: We just need to get one good shot on Sabotage, Cap! Once we knock her out, the rest of the fleet under her command won't know what to do.
This fleet we're up against is so strong that it's tough to get any closer to 'em!
Cap, now's not the time to second-guess all this! Silver bullets work on brujas - it's a basic scientific fact!
We can keep fighting her like we have been, but you are right - we need to do something different if we want to keep Sabotage away for good.
Maybe Fernando and Tommy can help out.
We need all the help we can get. It can't be only the Lone Ranger and Tonto on this one.
Sabotage is meaner than a skilletful of rattlesnakes, Cap. If we want to bring her to justice, we'll need to round up a posse on this one!
Where are Fernando and Tommy? We need to figure out a plan to take down Sabotage!
It's hard to have a meetin' of the minds in the middle of a battle, Cap!
*BOOM*
Never mind for now, Texas! Sabotage is coming back, so we just need to return fire!
Aye-aye, Cap!
*GUNFIRE* *MECHANICAL NEIGHS*
@BATTLE
Any ideas about how to take care of Sabotage?
It's a tough one, Cap. I feel like we've tried everything.
Si, Capitán, I can't think of anything either.
We've got silver bullets, Cap - but there's no way to get close enough to use 'em.

Fields.MenuText: You just gave me an amazing idea, Tommy!
We haven't been able to get close enough, huh?
We rounded up a posse and none of us can think of a plan? What kind of cowboys are you?

Fields.DialogueText: Well go ahead and shoot, Cap - 'cause we are plumb out of ideas!
That's right, Cap. We can load up our long guns with silver bullets all we want, but it'd be like pissin' in the wind compared to the salvos those Morganas are firin' at us with their main guns!
Jeez, Cap! We don't need ya to be so judgemental! We just need a plan!
I think I've got a way to get at her, but it'll require a team effort!
Yer the chief of this war party, Cap!
Sabotage is coming back at us with another salvo, Cap!
*BOOM*
Return fire! We need to buy a little time!
We can buy a little more time, Cap, but we're done short on credit!
*GUNFIRE*
@BATTLE
So what's the plan, Cap?
Any plan is better than sittin' here and tradin' salvos, Cap! We're already takin' on water!
This battleship's turning into a submarine if we don't act fast, Capitán!

Fields.MenuText: I was thinking about how a cattle drive has cowboys positioned all around the herd...
You know how you've been practicing your new trick shot lately?
Why does a boxer usually throw a jab before a hook?

Fields.DialogueText: Yep, it's important to control the herd from all sides so none of them dogies slips away. What's yer point, Cap?
Yep, I've been experimentin' with ricochet shots. You can angle a bullet off the floor and a few walls, and end up hittin' a bandito in the back where they least suspect it!
It's all about the setup, Cap. You can't help but react to block the jab comin' straight at you, then - wham! A left hook out of nowhere!
Right, so the main point is that we can't get close enough to Sabotage with the silver bullets in our rifles, because their range is nothing compared to artillery fire.
Our problem is that we're all on the same ship coming from one direction. We need to come at Sabotage from all sides at once. That way, one of us is bound to get close enough to hit her.
Sounds like common sense, Cap - and plans like those usually work. Fernando and Tommy, you two transfer over to some faster ships in the fleet, and come at Sabotage from opposite directions.
I'll stay here with the Captain, and we'll ride point straight up Sabotage's bow. If any of us has a clean shot at her, go ahead and take it!
*WHIRRING WHINNY*
Fernando and Tommy are in position on either side of Sabotage, and we're closing in on her fast.
We'll either take her out, or scatter our own fleet and get picked off one by one.
This ain't a gamble, Cap. We've got three Texans and a rocket horse in our posse, so we'll get our bandito.

Fields.MenuText: I wish I had your confidence, Texas!
The plan makes sense in theory, but it's always the execution that worries me.
The Lone Ranger, Tonto, and two Texans? Justice will be served!

Fields.DialogueText: Ain't no point in disbelievin' 'fore ya even try, Cap. That ain't how we do things in Texas.
Ya got me and Bluebonnet on point and two experienced cowhands ridin' flank - she's as good as sunk already, Cap!
That's the right attitude, Cap! Ain't nothin' a good team and a couple'a guns can't solve!
I know I started this sortie trying my hardest to impress you, Texas, but I'm not sure I'll ever be enough of a cowboy for you.
Now's not really the time to bring this up again, Cap...
That's not all I had to say - I wanted to tell you that I realized that learning how to be a cowboy isn't the most important thing in the world.
But learning what it means to have the heart of a cowboy - that's helped me become a better person... and a better captain.
And for that, I have to thank you... and Fernando and Tommy too, of course.
Aw, Cap... yer makin' me a little sentimental--
*BOOM*
We're getting as close as we're ever going to get, Texas...
Ya think so, Cap? Ya don't think we'll ever get any closer than this?
I wasn't talking about us, Texas - we're really close to Sabotage! So take that shot and let's hope that silver bullet does the trick!
Oh! Aye-aye, Cap! Here I go!
@BATTLE
*SNORT* *REV*
*SMUG WHIRRING*
*SEAGULLS*
I can't believe that you, Bluebonnet, Fernando, and Tommy all took your shots at Sabotage at the exact same time! You'll be arguing until the cows come home about who finally sank her!
It was obviously my shot, Cap! The way those crosswinds were blowin' - plus I'm just a naturally faster shot - neither of 'em even had a chance!
Well, we'll have plenty of time to debate the details over drinks while we're in port.
What are you up to in port this time, Cap?

Fields.MenuText: We'll need to pick up a few new horses. They really came in handy during that last sortie.
I suppose my next lesson is learning how to play poker?
The city seems louder than the last time we were here, but I'll see if I can find a good barbecue place in town.

Fields.DialogueText: Sounds like a plan, Cap! The war ain't endin' anytime soon, so we'll need plenty of fresh horses in the remuda. Just remember to pick out a few calm ones so ya don't fall off too much.
Did you get yer monthly pay yet, Cap? I play for keeps, ya hear?
Why pay good money for barbecue when you can make it better yerself, Cap? Just make sure ya start with the right recipe.
Ha! I'll keep that in mind. It's always an adventure with you, Texas!
I can't say I've ever had a better captain, so it's always a pleasure to sail with ya!
Well, we've got a lot of sailing ahead of us, so I hope it's not wearing on you too much.
I got the rest of my life to sit on the front porch, Cap. Might as well check out all the trails I haven't ridden yet.
*ALARM*
I'm looking forward to riding those trails right alongside you, Texas. Now let's mount up and bring a few more banditos to justice!
Aye-aye, Cap!
*PRIDEFUL SNORT*
You got a screw loose, Bluebonnet? You're gonna land yourself in the machine shop for a week straight with that kind o' talk.
*SELF-ASSURED SHRUG*
